abstract: Microsoft reports lower second-quarter income due to price cuts in its Windows and Xbox units; profit was $5.86 billion, or 71 cents a share, compared with $6.56 billion, or 78 cents a share, in year-ago quarter; revenue rose 8 percent to $26.47 billion.
lead_paragraph: The company said the weak personal computer market hurt its Windows business, as second-quarter net income dropped to $5.86 billion from $6.56 billion a year ago.
snippet: The company said the weak personal computer market hurt its Windows business, as second-quarter net income dropped to $5.86 billion from $6.56 billion a year ago.

headline.main: Price Cuts for Crucial Microsoft Products Eroded Holiday-Season Profit
headline.print_headline: Price Cuts for Crucial Microsoft Products Eroded Holiday-Season Profit
